name: yarn production, silk, short fibre | yarn, silk | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21937/documentation

This dataset is constructed using "yarn production, cotton, open end spinning" as an approximation. Short fibres of silk is a by-product of silk reeling and it cannot be directly twisted like other short length fibres. Regarding quality, yarn, silk, has lower sheen and lustre and therefore is used for products other than textiles (where highest quality is preferred) like carpets etc.

Activity starts with short fibres.

This activity ends with produced 1 kg  yarn.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: since this dataset reflects a handloom process, there are no machinery modelled
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data has been obtained from a Silk reeling and spinning plant located in Hoshangabad in the state of Madhya Pradesh (Central India) based on the representativeness of currently used technology,

exchanges.description: There is no coproduct or waste being generated here. Since, reeled silk is simply doubled up and rereeled in this process. No recircularisation either.
